Perfect for LinkedIn creators, professionals, and marketers who want to increase engagement by 60%. All formatting works natively on LinkedIn without any special tools. Browser-based with complete privacy.

instructions.title: How to use LinkedIn Post Formatter

steps.title: Write or paste your post
steps.description: Enter your LinkedIn post text in the input area. The character counter shows your progress toward LinkedIn's 3,000 character limit.

steps.title: Select text to format
steps.description: Highlight the text you want to format. You can select individual words, sentences, or entire paragraphs.

steps.title: Apply formatting styles
steps.description: Click the formatting buttons to apply bold, italic, underline, or strikethrough. Add bullet points or numbered lists for better readability.

steps.title: Preview and copy
steps.description: Preview how your post will look on desktop and mobile. When satisfied, copy the formatted text and paste it directly into LinkedIn.

troubleshooting: Formatting not appearing: Ensure you're copying the formatted text, not the original. The Unicode characters carry the formatting.
Text looks different on LinkedIn: Some Unicode styles render slightly different across devices. Bold and italic are most consistent.
Character count exceeded: LinkedIn has a 3,000 character limit. Unicode formatting doesn't add extra characters.
Formatting removed after posting: LinkedIn occasionally strips certain Unicode ranges. Stick to standard bold and italic for best results.
Preview differs from actual post: Preview is an approximation. LinkedIn's rendering may vary slightly.
Bullet points not aligned: Use consistent bullet styles. Mixing Unicode bullets may cause alignment issues.
Mobile preview not accurate: Actual mobile rendering depends on device and app version. Preview shows general appearance.
Copy button not working: Ensure your browser allows clipboard access. Try selecting and copying manually.
